text:
Will be reviewing the food court.

Most stalls are opened at this time. Good spread of food choices.

Place is big and airy. There is an outdoor dining area too for those who prefer sitting away from the stalls.

Good ambience.

Midview City offers free parking for the first hour from 7 am to 7 pm; and from 7 pm to 12 am. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, enjoy free parking from 7 am to 12 am.

This is a 60-year (from 2008) leasehold Commercial Building. Midview City is a mega integrated business hub. Centrally located and with superb connectivity to all major parts of Singapore. The building is sited in over 552,000 square feet land space. It is an eight story building and an exclusive 3 story terrace block which offers more than luxurious space of prime business space.

Midview City is accessible through the nearest train stations such as Bright Hill MRT (TE7 CR13) Thomson-East Coast Line Due 2020, Upper Thomson MRT (TE8) Thomson-East Coast Line Due 2020, and Teck Ghee (CR12). The nearest primary schools are Ai Tong School, Catholic High School, and Ang Mo Kio Primary School.

It is close to amenities like NTUC FAIRPRICE (THOMSON PLAZA), Giant(thomson Imperial Court), and Sheng Siong Hypermarket(ang Mo Kio 233). The closest shopping malls are THOMSON PLAZA, BISHAN NORTH SHOPPING MALL, and KKH The Retail Mall.

Widely spaced buildings with surface and sheltered parking for office staff and guests. I was at Block 24 level 5 and came across this shop that carries interesting Aromatherapy products. There's even a product for Eczema condition and it comes in both Children and Adult versions!

It's very far from Marymount station, people who are going to grab office if you are walking it's about 20-25 min.
Better to travel by car

A massive structure that is almost in the middle of nowhere, with numerous start up offices here. Standing at 8 storeys tall with close to a hundred units per floor, it's not surprising that they call this place a city. Getting here is difficult though, as the place is only accessible by car or foot. Closest bus stop is about 10 minutes walk away. Not an entirely convenient place.
